intro: Galium fleurotii var. gracilicaule, commonly known as slender-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually oval to elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in the axils of the leaves, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements make it a notable species in botanical studies.
